entry.title: Bridge returned error 400! (18721)
entry.content:
Twitter @leslieherod was unable to receive or process the remote website's content!
Error message: `The requested resource cannot be found!
Please make sure your input parameters are correct!
cUrl error: (0)
PHP error: `
Query string: `action=display&bridge=Twitter&context=By+username&u=leslieherod&norep=on&nopic=on&noimg=on&format=Atom`
Version: `dev.2020-02-26`

  • Press Return to check your input parameters
  • Press F5 to retry
  • Check if this issue was already reported on GitHub (give it a thumbs-up)
  • Open a GitHub Issue if this error persists

pmaziere

entry.title: "Blackpackers is a nonprofit that aims to address the gap...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

"Blackpackers is a nonprofit that aims to address the gap in representation in the outdoors. The organization provides gear, outdoor excursions and education for free or at a reduced cost."

CBS Denver

People from all over the world vacation in the Rocky Mountains, but resorts aren’t seeing much diversity of the slopes.

denver.cbslocal.com|By CBS Denver

Blackpackers Group Bridging Diversity Gap On Colorado's Slopes

People from all over the world vacation in the Rocky Mountains, but resorts aren’t seeing much diversity of the slopes.People from all over the world vacation in the Rocky Mountains, but resorts aren’t seeing much diversity of the slopes.

entry.title: "If we don't begin to focus on health equity and...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

"If we don't begin to focus on health equity and positive health outcomes for all people, especially people that data shows us are not thriving, not having positive outcomes, people will continue to die."

9NEWS (KUSA)

Nurses are taking a hard look at their ranks and a top down scrutiny of a lack of diversity.

9news.com

Diversifying the nursing workforce in Colorado

Nurses are taking a hard look at their ranks and a top down scrutiny of a lack of diversity.Nurses are taking a hard look at their ranks and a top down scrutiny of a lack of diversity.

entry.title: "Van Gogh Alive," a large, family-friendly,...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

"Van Gogh Alive," a large, family-friendly, multi-sensory experience that immerses visitors in Vincent Van Gogh’s paintings, is coming to Denver this summer."

Denver7

"Van Gogh Alive," a large, family-friendly, multi-sensory experience that immerses visitors in Vincent Van Gogh’s paintings, is coming to Denver this summer.

thedenverchannel.com

Immersive 'Van Gogh Alive' exhibit coming to Denver this summer

"Van Gogh Alive," a large, family-friendly, multi-sensory experience that immerses visitors in Vincent Van Gogh’s paintings, is coming to Denver this summer."Van Gogh Alive," a large, family-friendly, multi-sensory experience that immerses visitors in Vincent Van Gogh’s paintings, is coming to Denver this summer.

entry.title: "...Our Brown Boy Joy, a company aimed at delivering...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

"...Our Brown Boy Joy, a company aimed at delivering uplifting messages to boys of color. At 8 years old, Dee is the CEO."

Beacon Journal

Demetrius "Dee" Davis has a new friend, and he looks just like him.

beaconjournal.com

Focus on Black-owned businesses: 8-year-old CEO uplifts kids like him with Our Brown Boy Joy

Demetrius "Dee" Davis has a new friend, and he looks just like him.Demetrius "Dee" Davis has a new friend, and he looks just like him.

entry.title: "For people serving time in jail or prison, it may seem...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

"For people serving time in jail or prison, it may seem like punishment ends on the day of release. But in fact, thousands of restrictions dictate the terms of life after incarceration, too."

NPR

There are 45,000 laws, policies and administrative sanctions in the U.S. that target people with criminal records. Reuben Jonathan Miller researches how they affect people's lives in Halfway Home.

npr.org

Out Of Prison But Still Trapped: Examining The 'Afterlife' Of Incarceration

There are 45,000 laws, policies and administrative sanctions in the U.S. that target people with criminal records. Reuben Jonathan Miller researches how they affect people's lives in Halfway Home.There are 45,000 laws, policies and administrative sanctions in the U.S. that target people with criminal records. Reuben Jonathan Miller researches how they affect people's lives in Halfway Home.

entry.title: "Predominantly Black neighborhoods have less access to...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

"Predominantly Black neighborhoods have less access to primary care physicians and healthcare services, at a time when COVID-19 is killing Black Americans at a rate 2.3 times higher than white Americans. Now grassroots organizations are trying to compensate for failures of public health."

The Appeal

Predominantly Black neighborhoods have less access to primary care physicians and healthcare services, at a time when COVID-19 is killing Black Americans at a rate 2.3 times higher than white Americans. Now grassroots organizations are trying to compensate for failures of public health.

theappeal.org

Healthcare In The U.S. Is Still Segregated, So Community Organizations Are Taking COVID-19 Testing Into Their Own Hands

Predominantly Black neighborhoods have less access to primary care physicians and healthcare services, at a time when COVID-19 is killing Black Americans at a rate 2.3 times higher than white Americans. Now grassroots organizations are trying to compensate for failures of public health.Predominantly Black neighborhoods have less access to primary care physicians and healthcare services, at a time when COVID-19 is killing Black Americans at a rate 2.3 times higher than white Americans. Now grassroots organizations are trying to compensate for failures of public health.

entry.title: "Substance use disorders and other problems cannot be...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

"Substance use disorders and other problems cannot be addressed from a position of willful ignorance about our society’s inequalities."

Scientific American

Substance use disorders and other problems cannot be addressed from a position of willful ignorance about our society’s inequalities

scientificamerican.com

To Achieve Mental Health Equity, Dismantle Social Injustice

entry.title: "The imagery of Georgia Rep. Park Cannon being dragged away...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

"The imagery of Georgia Rep. Park Cannon being dragged away this week at the state Capitol follows several arrests in recent years involving elected Black women. Black women on the receiving end say it’s an effort to silence their growing political power."

MsMagazine.com

Georgia Rep. Park Cannon is one of several Black women arrested or facing criminal charges because of their work in statehouses or in communities.

msmagazine.com

Law Enforcement Officers Keep Arresting Black Women Elected Officials - Ms. Magazine

Georgia Rep. Park Cannon is one of several Black women arrested or facing criminal charges because of their work in statehouses or in communities.Georgia Rep. Park Cannon is one of several Black women arrested or facing criminal charges because of their work in statehouses or in communities.

entry.title: "Biden’s American Rescue Plan is a start, but more public...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

"Biden’s American Rescue Plan is a start, but more public investment is needed to address racial inequality in the labor market."

The Appeal

Biden’s American Rescue Plan is a start, but more public investment is needed to address racial inequality in the labor market.

theappeal.org

The U.S. Economy Won’t Recover Until Black Workers Do

Biden’s American Rescue Plan is a start, but more public investment is needed to address racial inequality in the labor market.Biden’s American Rescue Plan is a start, but more public investment is needed to address racial inequality in the labor market.

entry.title: "It’s time to stop mythologizing Black women trying to...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

"It’s time to stop mythologizing Black women trying to survive in a world that doesn’t value them."

Healthline

Despite social media calls to "thank a Black woman" and the superhero status of Stacey Abrams and Amanda Gorman, we're still one of the most undervalued groups in the United States — and it's killing us.

healthline.com

As Black Women, We Need to Save Ourselves, Not the World

Despite social media calls to "thank a Black woman" and the superhero status of Stacey Abrams and Amanda Gorman, we're still one of the most undervalued groups in the United States — and it's killing us.Despite social media calls to "thank a Black woman" and the superhero status of Stacey Abrams and Amanda Gorman, we're still one of the most undervalued groups in the United States — and it's killing us.

entry.title: "As has been the case throughout the rest of the country,...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

"As has been the case throughout the rest of the country, hate crimes against people of Asian descent have increased in the Centennial State in recent months."

5280 Magazine

As has been the case throughout the rest of the country, hate crimes against people of Asian descent have increased in Colorado since last March.

5280.com

Anti-Asian Racism Is on the Rise in Colorado

As has been the case throughout the rest of the country, hate crimes against people of Asian descent have increased in Colorado since last March.As has been the case throughout the rest of the country, hate crimes against people of Asian descent have increased in Colorado since last March.

entry.content:

"Through the 1-800 Happy Birthday Project, Mohammad Gorjestani invited callers to leave messages for Black and Latino people who died in encounters with law enforcement."

The New York Times

Through the 1-800 Happy Birthday Project, Mohammad Gorjestani invited callers to leave messages for Black and Latino people who died in encounters with law enforcement.

nytimes.com

entry.title: "For artist Vanessa German, poetry is a ‘place of power,...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

"For artist Vanessa German, poetry is a ‘place of power, it is a force that dissolves the tangles and nooses of white supremacy and systemic racism"

The Undefeated

The first poet and author was a woman. A high priestess, in fact, whose works worshipped the goddess Inanna. Enheduanna was said to live in 2285 to 2250 B.C. in…

theundefeated.com

Poetry is a tool for Black women to connect to their own divinity

The first poet and author was a woman. A high priestess, in fact, whose works worshipped the goddess Inanna. Enheduanna was said to live in 2285 to 2250 B.C. in…The first poet and author was a woman. A high priestess, in fact, whose works worshipped the goddess Inanna. Enheduanna was said to live in 2285 to 2250 B.C. in…

entry.title: "Democratic state Rep. Park Cannon, a Black woman,...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

"Democratic state Rep. Park Cannon, a Black woman, continued knocking on Kemp's office door after Georgia State Patrol troopers instructed her to stop.

She said later she was arrested for "fighting voter suppression." A law signed by Kemp on Thursday includes new limitations on mail-in voting, expands most voters' access to in-person early voting and caps a months-long battle over voting in a battleground state."

NPR

Democratic state Rep. Park Cannon, a Black woman, is facing charges after refusing to stop knocking on Georgia Gov. Brian Kemp's office door.

npr.org

Georgia Lawmaker Arrested As Governor Signs Law Overhauling Elections

Democratic state Rep. Park Cannon, a Black woman, is facing charges after refusing to stop knocking on Georgia Gov. Brian Kemp's office door.Democratic state Rep. Park Cannon, a Black woman, is facing charges after refusing to stop knocking on Georgia Gov. Brian Kemp's office door.

entry.title: "If you can’t see yourself in the conversation being had...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

"If you can’t see yourself in the conversation being had betwixt and between these lines, the poem becomes a question: What have you chosen to ignore during your days? Selected by Reginald Dwayne Betts"

The New York Times

If you can’t see yourself in the conversation being had between these lines, the poem becomes a question: What have you chosen to ignore during your days?

nytimes.com

Poem: Note to Black Women in America

entry.title: "Following this week’s mass shooting in Boulder that...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

"Following this week’s mass shooting in Boulder that killed 10 people, Colorado U.S. Rep. Joe Neguse called on President Joe Biden to ban semiautomatic rifles and high-capacity ammunition magazines that are imported from abroad."

The Denver Post

The letter sent to President Joe Biden on Thursday was signed by more than 60 lawmakers, including all of Colorado’s congressional Democrats.

denverpost.com

Boulder shooting spurs Neguse to call on Biden for ban on imported semiautomatic rifles, high-capacity magazines

The letter sent to President Joe Biden on Thursday was signed by more than 60 lawmakers, including all of Colorado’s congressional Democrats.The letter sent to President Joe Biden on Thursday was signed by more than 60 lawmakers, including all of Colorado’s congressional Democrats.

entry.title: "It's been like this all her life. Virginia lawmakers...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

"It's been like this all her life. Virginia lawmakers last month for the first time approved five sick days to some home health-care workers. Paid vacation is a dream. 'Work work work' is a ringtone one of her grandchildren set for Barnes: "She said, 'Nanny, when you call me, I know it's you, because that's all you do is work.' "

NPR

'Mad As Hell': A Look Inside Life At Just Above Minimum WageA juicy prime rib. A glossy art book. A few days off work without worrying about bills. These are the unreachable desires of some of America's workers earning close to minimum wage.'Mad As Hell': A Look Inside Life At Just Above Minimum WageA juicy prime rib. A glossy art book. A few days off work without worrying about bills. These are the unreachable desires of some of America's workers earning close to minimum wage.'Mad As Hell': A Look Inside Life At Just Above Minimum WageA juicy prime rib. A glossy art book. A few days off work without worrying about bills. These are the unreachable desires of some of America's workers earning close to minimum wage.'Mad As Hell': A Look Inside Life At Just Above Minimum WageA juicy prime rib. A glossy art book. A few days off work without worrying about bills. These are the unreachable desires of some of America's workers earning close to minimum wage.See more at NPR.ORG

entry.title: "Young Black men and teens made up more than a third of...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

"Young Black men and teens made up more than a third of firearm homicide victims in the USA in 2019, one of several disparities revealed in a review of gun mortality data released Tuesday by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention."

USA TODAY

CDC data shows stark racial disparities: In 2019, Black men and boys were 20 times more likely to die in a gun homicide than their white counterparts.

usatoday.com

Young Black men and teens are killed by guns 20 times more than their white counterparts, CDC data shows

CDC data shows stark racial disparities: In 2019, Black men and boys were 20 times more likely to die in a gun homicide than their white counterparts.CDC data shows stark racial disparities: In 2019, Black men and boys were 20 times more likely to die in a gun homicide than their white counterparts.

entry.title: Incredibly humbled by this feature in 5280 and honored to have...
entry.content:
Representative Leslie Herod

Incredibly humbled by this feature in 5280 and honored to have community support for this work. We all have a story to tell. Our stories are our strength and our voices will be heard.

"Forget political stereotypes: This history-making legislator is unapologetically progressive, is insistent that state government can be bipartisan (even now), and wants to transform the criminal justice system. And that's just the start of her ambitions.”

- 5280 Magazine

...

📸 Paul Miller Photography
Hair: Dornise LaTone Afhair
Styling: LILFRESHSAM

See MoreForget political stereotypes: This history-making legislator is unapologetically progressive, is insistent that state government can be bipartisan (even now), and wants to transform the criminal justice system. And that's just the start of her ambitions.

5280.com

State Representative Leslie Herod Has a Story to Share | 5280

Forget political stereotypes: This history-making legislator is unapologetically progressive, is insistent that state government can be bipartisan (even now), and wants to transform the criminal justice system. And that's just the start of her ambitions.Forget political stereotypes: This history-making legislator is unapologetically progressive, is insistent that state government can be bipartisan (even now), and wants to transform the criminal justice system. And that's just the start of her ambitions.
